person.persName: David Short Goodloe (Lexington, Kentucky, farmer, merchant, and politician)

body.p: Lexington, Kentucky, farmer, merchant, and politician. Married to Sally A. Clay Goodloe. Father of Speed S. Goodloe, W. Cassius Goodloe, David L. Goodloe, and Green Clay Goodloe. Owned five enslaved persons in 1850. Owned nine enslaved persons in 1860. Member of the Whig Party, Republican Party, and Union Party. Farmer in Madison County, Kentucky. Deputy sheriff in Madison County, Kentucky under his father. Bookseller in Lexington in 1850. Served in the Kentucky State Militia, attaining the rank of major general. China merchant in Lexington in 1860. Appointed by President Abraham Lincoln as assessor in 1864. Chairman and member of the Union Executive Committee of Kentucky in 1865.
